meanings.definition: Paleobotanists: Scientists who study ancient plant life.
meanings.sent1: The paleobotanists carefully examined the fossilized leaves.
meanings.sent2: Many paleobotanists work in museums and universities.
meanings.sent3: The paleobotanists joked that the ancient ferns were like plant time travelers.
meanings.sent4: In the world of paleobotanists, each fossil tells a story of the past.
meanings.sent5: The paleobotanists' discoveries shed light on the history of plant evolution.

meanings.definition: Paleobotanists: The study of fossilized plants.
meanings.sent1: Studying paleobotanists involves analyzing plant fossils.
meanings.sent2: The course on paleobotanists covers various plant species from the past.
meanings.sent3: The paleobotanists' lab was filled with ancient plant remains.
meanings.sent4: To understand paleobotanists, one must delve into the world of ancient flora.
meanings.sent5: The museum exhibit showcased the work of paleobotanists throughout history.

meanings.definition: Paleobotanists: Experts in the field of paleobotany.
meanings.sent1: The paleobotanists' conference attracted researchers from around the world.
meanings.sent2: Many universities offer degrees for aspiring paleobotanists.
meanings.sent3: The paleobotanists' knowledge of ancient plants was unmatched.
meanings.sent4: In the scientific community, paleobotanists are highly respected for their expertise.
meanings.sent5: The paleobotanists' findings revolutionized our understanding of prehistoric vegetation.
